required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Usability of the MAK Exoskeleton in Patients With Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Usability of the MAK Exoskeleton in Patients With Stroke

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the safety and usability of a motorized mobility assistance exoskeleton (MAK). The procedure explores the use of the MAK exoskeleton during the static and dynamic rehabilitation sessions with the intention to evaluate the safety and usability of the device in the studied population. The protocol has been focused on defining how the device can be used appropriately in this population in a safe manner by rehabilitation specialists.The study also aims to assess the safety of clinicians implementing the intervention, as well as possible benefits derived from the use of the device. As a secondary outcome, efficacy measurements will be collected.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety as number of serious device adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: after each use of exoskeleton, for 5 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Presence of a serious device adverse events where the participant or therapist is involved

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as presence of adverse events or adverse device events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after each use of exoskeleton, for 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of a device adverse events where the participant or therapist is involved

secondary_outcome.measure: Exercises [measured as time per exercise in seconds]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after each use of exoskeleton, for 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as time per event at each therapy session

secondary_outcome.measure: Transfers [measured as time to carry out the transfers in seconds]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At each use of exoskeleton, for 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as time and level of assistance to carry out the transfers

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability [number of participants which discontinue the participation during the trial in relation with the included participants]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as abandon ratio

secondary_outcome.measure: Accessibility [number of potential participants in relation with the included participants]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: Measured as relation between number of participants and number of potential participants which weren't recruited

secondary_outcome.measure: Fall Prevalence [number of falls during the using of the device]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the use of the device, for 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Number of falling events ocurred from the participant or therapist

secondary_outcome.measure: Skin integrity [number of skin injuries related to the device]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: before and after each use of exoskeleton, for 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: skin integrity measured as the number of skin injuries

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Pain registered before and after the use of the device, by the participant and therapist

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Fatigue registered before and after the use of the device, by the participant and therapist

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Spasticity registered before and after the use of the device

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Number of heart beats per minute

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical evaluation [number of physical injuries detected]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Physical Evaluation as presence of tissue damage

secondary_outcome.measure: Muscle Strength [measured with Hand Held Dynamometer in N]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the first day, 3rd week and 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: Muscle Strength measured at hip, knee and ankle muscles

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the first day, 3rd week and 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: Range of Movement

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the first day, 3rd week and 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: Functional Mobility with and without the device

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of System's Usability measured by the therapist

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: QUEST 2.0 will be assessed by the therapist and participant

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the first day, 3rd week and 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: 6MWT recorded using the device

secondary_outcome.measure: Device malfunction [as number and type of device malfunction]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the use of the device, for 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Any device malfunction will be recorded

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the first day, 3rd week and 5th week
secondary_outcome.description: Timed Up and Go Scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Number of breaths per 1 minute

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic and Diastolic Pressure measured in mmHg

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the use of the device, during 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: SpO2 measured in %

arm_group.description: The Intervention Group will receive 9 physical rehabilitation sessions using the MAK device. Each session will consist of approximately 90 minutes.

intervention.description: The participants will assist to 9 physical rehabilitation sessions with the MAK exoskeleton. During these sessions, different movements and therapies will be conducted using the studied device.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 18 and 85 years
- Weight < 100 kg
- Height between 1.5 and 1.9 meters
- Anthropometric measurements to fit in the exoskeleton:
- Distance from the center of the knee joint to the ground: 42 - 55 cm
- Distance from the center of the knee to the groin fold: more than 28 cm.
- Perimeter in thigh (midpoint trochanter - epicondyle): 40 - 63 cm.
- Perimeter in calf (point of greater volume): 30 - 44 cm.
- Ability to follow simple commands and communicate basic needs
- Presence of unilateral hemiparesis
- Diagnosis of stroke confirmed with imaging tests.
- Sub-acute or chronic patients (time since diagnosis 1 month or more)
- Score on FAC scale from 1 to 4
- Sufficient postural control to maintain standing posture and to take a step with the weight on the affected lower limb, manual assistance or technical aids being allowed
Exclusion Criteria:
- Spasticity > 3 in lower limbs according to the MAS scale
- Skin alterations in the contact areas with the exoskeleton
- Planned surgical intervention during the duration of the study
- Two or more osteoporotic fractures in the lower limbs in the last 2 years
- Presence of other pathologies that cause exercise intolerance (such as uncontrolled hypertension, coronary artery disease, arrhythmia, congestive heart failure, Parkinson's, severe lung disease)
- Surgical operation in the 3 months prior to the start of the study on the lower limbs

patient_data.ipd_description: There's no intention to share the individual participant data with researchers outside the scope of the present study. The participant data will be collected anonymized using a code for each participant. The data will be collected and stored according to the EU regulations and local laws and guidelines.
